primitive_modes.name: Connection
primitive_modes.description: General linkage between two entities without altering semantics.

primitive_modes.name: Segmentation
primitive_modes.description: Connect while filtering or narrowing scope to a subset.

primitive_modes.name: Synthesis
primitive_modes.description: Integrate multiple sources into a coherent blend.

primitive_modes.name: Alternation
primitive_modes.description: Switch between interchangeable options or pathways.

primitive_modes.name: Recursion
primitive_modes.description: Self-referential link that enables repeated traversal.

primitive_modes.name: Instantiation
primitive_modes.description: Create or spawn a concrete instance from a template.

primitive_modes.name: Superposition
primitive_modes.description: Overlay or layer multiple signals without full merge.

primitive_modes.name: Nullification
primitive_modes.description: Mute, disable, or void an existing link.

primitive_modes.name: Mapping
primitive_modes.description: Align fields or coordinates between domains.

primitive_modes.name: Aggregation
primitive_modes.description: Combine multiple records into a grouped representation.

primitive_modes.name: Validation
primitive_modes.description: Gate or guard a connection with checks and policies.

primitive_modes.name: Transformation
primitive_modes.description: Adapt or reshape data as it flows across the link.

compound_metamodes.name: Contextual Connection
compound_metamodes.description: Link two entities while constraining scope to a filtered subset.
compound_metamodes.best_for: joining datasets with guardrails or feature flags

compound_metamodes.name: Fusion Bridge
compound_metamodes.description: Connect while actively blending both sides into a shared view.
compound_metamodes.best_for: dashboards that stitch metrics with dimensions

compound_metamodes.name: Selective Synthesis
compound_metamodes.description: Filter inputs before merging them to maintain signal clarity.
compound_metamodes.best_for: feature stores that require curated joins

compound_metamodes.name: Recursive Harmonization
compound_metamodes.description: Iteratively revisit links to keep merged context aligned.
compound_metamodes.best_for: systems that self-correct based on prior outputs

compound_metamodes.name: Instantiated Definition
compound_metamodes.description: Create a new instance while stamping it with authoritative meaning.

compound_metamodes.name: Layered Alternation
compound_metamodes.description: Overlay multiple variants and toggle the active one in place.

compound_metamodes.name: Guarded Mapping
compound_metamodes.description: Align schemas or endpoints while enforcing validation gates.
compound_metamodes.best_for: API contracts and ETL field mapping

compound_metamodes.name: Aggregate Blend
compound_metamodes.description: Roll multiple inputs up and blend the aggregate into downstream flows.

compound_metamodes.name: Validated Transformation
compound_metamodes.description: Adapt data and immediately verify the converted form.

compound_metamodes.name: Routed Connection
compound_metamodes.description: Bridge entities while explicitly mapping fields or identities.

compound_metamodes.name: Adaptive Connection
compound_metamodes.description: Link entities and transform payloads as they traverse the bridge.

compound_metamodes.name: Mapped Transformation
compound_metamodes.description: Route attributes to new shapes and reshape them in one step.

usage_notes: Compound metamodes describe two compatible modes that connect to each other to form a richer bridge.
Use the codes directly (e.g., CON+SYN) when you want hints for mixed behavior in the connection form.
Each primitive mode can still be used independently; compounds simply document intentional combinations.
Add new compounds by combining existing primitive codes and providing clear guidance on when to use them.
